context:
1 Nyquist Server 
Installation 
1
Nyquist Server Installation Options
Two options are available for installing and deploying Nyquist E7000:
1 Using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL), which already 
has the operating system and E7000 application software installed 
on it.
2 Using your own server platform and installing the Debian OS and 
E7000 application software. While Option 1 is the quickest and 
easiest approach, Option 2 may be better suited for situations 
where high-availability server features like Redundant Array of 
Independent Disks (RAID) or hot-swappable power supplies are 
desired.
This manual describes the installation steps for Option 1.
Before installing Nyquist, ensure that:
• Required services are enabled on your network. An example of a 
required service includes TFTP.
• Required multicast IP addresses and ports are known and avail-
able.
• Required IP addresses are known and available.
• Required port numbers are open.
Both the Debian software and the Nyquist software are already 
installed on the System Controller. You only need to supply a product 
license, which will then activate the product and guide you through 
Note: This manual provides the Nyquist E7000 installation process 
when using the Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL). If you are 
using your own server, refer to the Nyquist E7000 Server Installation 
and Setup Guide.

qas.question: What are the two options available for installing Nyquist E7000?

answers.text: The two options available for installing Nyquist E7000 are: 1) Using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL) with the operating system and E7000 application already installed, and 2) Using your own server platform by installing Debian OS and the E7000 application software yourself. Option 1 is simpler, while Option 2 allows for high-availability features.

qas.question: What does the Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL) come with pre-installed?

answers.text: The Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL) comes with the Debian operating system and the E7000 application software pre-installed. This allows for a quicker and easier installation process.

qas.question: What might make Option 2 for installation more suitable for certain situations?

answers.text: Option 2 for installation may be more suitable in situations where high-availability server features are required, such as Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) or hot-swappable power supplies. This option allows for greater flexibility and customization of the server platform to meet specific operational needs.

qas.question: What is required to be known and available before installing Nyquist?

answers.text: Before installing Nyquist, it is required to know and have available the necessary multicast IP addresses and ports, as well as the required IP addresses and open port numbers on your network. Additionally, ensure that required services, such as TFTP, are enabled.

qas.question: What step is necessary after supplying a product license during the installation process?

answers.text: After supplying a product license during the installation process, you will need to activate the product, which will guide you through the remaining configuration steps.

qas.question: Which installation option is described in the manual?

answers.text: The manual describes the installation process for Option 1, which involves using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL) that comes with the operating system and E7000 application software pre-installed. This option is highlighted as the quickest and easiest approach for setting up Nyquist E7000.

qas.question: What type of services must be enabled on the network for Nyquist installation?

answers.text: Required services that must be enabled on the network for Nyquist installation include TFTP and any other necessary services relevant to network operations. Additionally, ensure that multicast IP addresses and ports, as well as specific IP addresses and port numbers, are known and available.

qas.question: Which specific features might be preferable when using your own server platform?

answers.text: Using your own server platform may be preferable for high-availability features such as Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) and hot-swappable power supplies. These features enhance system reliability and uptime, making them suitable for critical applications.

qas.question: Where can you find the installation steps for using your own server with Nyquist?

answers.text: You can find the installation steps for using your own server with Nyquist in the "Nyquist E7000 Server Installation and Setup Guide." This guide is specifically for situations where you are installing the software on your own server platform.

context:
2
several setup wizards. (See "System Controller Setup Assistant” on 
page 7.)
If you are updating an existing Nyquist system, read "Best Practices” 
on page 49 and then refer to the update procedure in the System 
Administrator Manual.
1.1
Understanding System Requirements
The E7000 web-based UI requires a secure Hypertext Transfer Proto-
col Secure (https) type network connection to the E7000 system 
server. Users can log in to the E7000 system using the Google 
Chrome web browser from a computer or tablet running either a 
Windows 8.1 (or later) or a Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later) operating 
system (OS). The UI can also be accessed via a Chrome browser 
enabled Android-based tablet or mobile device. To access the server, 
type your server’s IP address (for example, 10.10.20.12).
1.1.1
Whitelisted Web Addresses
E7000 requires access to specific Uniform Resource Locators (URLs), 
commonly referred to as web addresses. Access to many of these 
web addresses is required during installation; access to other web 
addresses, such as the address for the Network Time Server (NTS) are 
required during runtime. The Information Technology (IT) depart-
ment for the site must whitelist the web addresses so that they can 
be easily accessed as needed.
The following table lists the URLs that must be whitelisted.
Table 1-1, Whitelisted Web Sites
URL
Description
http://hostedactivation.com (specifically, 
http://hostedactivation.com/bogen)
Required for E7000 License support
http://downloads.digium.com
Required for downloads from Digium 
Phone Module for Asterisk (DPMA)
http://downloads.asterisk.org/ (specifically, 
http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/
telephony/sounds/releases)
Required for sounds download
http://www.pjsip.org/
Required for PJSIP download
http://ftp.us.debian.org (specifically: http://
ftp.us.debian.org/debian/)
Required during Linux package installation

qas.question: What type of network connection is required to access the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: To access the E7000 web-based UI, a secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (https) network connection is required. Users can log in using the Google Chrome web browser on devices running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later), as well as Android-based tablets or mobile devices.

qas.question: Which web browsers can be used to log in to the E7000 system?

answers.text: Users can log in to the E7000 system using the Google Chrome web browser on a computer or tablet running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later). The UI can also be accessed via a Chrome browser on Android-based tablets or mobile devices.

qas.question: What operating systems are compatible with the E7000 system UI?

answers.text: The E7000 system UI is compatible with Windows 8.1 (or later) and Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later). It can also be accessed using a Chrome browser on Android-based tablets or mobile devices.

qas.question: Which type of devices can access the E7000 system via the Chrome browser?

answers.text: The E7000 system can be accessed via the Chrome browser on computers or tablets running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later), as well as Android-based tablets or mobile devices. Users must connect through a secure HTTPS network.

qas.question: Why must specific URLs be whitelisted by the IT department for the E7000?

answers.text: Specific URLs must be whitelisted by the IT department for the E7000 to ensure access to essential resources required during installation and runtime, such as license support, downloads for the Digium Phone Module, sound files, PJSIP downloads, and Linux package installations. This access is critical for the proper functioning of the E7000 system.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the URL http://hostedactivation.com?

answers.text: The URL http://hostedactivation.com is required for E7000 License support. Specifically, users need access to the sub-page http://hostedactivation.com/bogen for activation-related purposes.

qas.question: What resources can be downloaded from http://downloads.digium.com?

answers.text: The resource that can be downloaded from http://downloads.digium.com is the Digium Phone Module for Asterisk (DPMA). This module is essential for integrating Digium phones with the Asterisk platform.

qas.question: What kind of content can be accessed at http://downloads.asterisk.org/?

answers.text: The content at http://downloads.asterisk.org/ primarily includes software downloads and resources related to the Asterisk open-source communication framework. Specifically, it hosts sound files and releases essential for the Asterisk platform.

qas.question: What is the significance of the URL http://www.pjsip.org/ in relation to the E7000 system?

answers.text: The URL http://www.pjsip.org/ is significant for the E7000 system as it is required for downloading the PJSIP library, which is essential for facilitating SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) communications within the system. Access to this URL must be whitelisted for proper functionality.

qas.question: Why is access to http://ftp.us.debian.org important during Linux package installation?

answers.text: Access to http://ftp.us.debian.org is important during Linux package installation because it serves as a repository for downloading necessary Debian packages. These packages are essential for the proper setup and operation of the E7000 system on a Linux platform.

context:
3
URLs that are entered on the E7000 System Parameters page are 
used during runtime and include the URLs for the NTS, the Session 
Traversal Utilities for (Network Address Translation (NAT) (STUN) 
server, and the Traversal Using Relays around NAT (TURN) server.
The default URLs for the STUN and TURN servers are not set. The 
default URL for NTS is pool.ntp.org.
1.1.2
Network Application Services
Required  application services will be installed automatically on the 
E7000 system server as part of the E7000 installation. All other net-
work services must be already present or installed manually on the 
associated network. The following table lists the services and their 
locations:
http://security.debian.org (specifically: 
http://security.debian.org/)
Required during Linux package installation
stun01.sipphone.com
Required for STUN based IP address 
resolution (This is used by the E7000 Web 
UI and should be enabled on the computer 
that runs the web UI.)
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/
Serves unprocessed versions of files stored 
in the GitHub repositories.
http://2431612419.airable.io
https://2431612419.airable.io
airable URL
http://api.sound-machine.com
https://api.sound-machine.com
SoundMachine URL
http://api.bogenedu.com/api/customers
Required for E7000 Warranty Support
Table 1-1, Whitelisted Web Sites (Continued)
URL
Description

qas.question: What are the default URLs for the NTS, STUN, and TURN servers on the E7000 System?

answers.text: The default URL for the NTS (Network Time Server) on the E7000 System is pool.ntp.org. The default URLs for the STUN (Session Traversal Utilities for NAT) and TURN (Traversal Using Relays around NAT) servers are not set.

qas.question: Which application services are automatically installed during the E7000 installation?

answers.text: During the E7000 installation, required application services are automatically installed on the E7000 system server. All other network services must either be present beforehand or installed manually on the associated network.

qas.question: What URL is required for STUN based IP address resolution in the E7000 system?

answers.text: The URL required for STUN-based IP address resolution in the E7000 system is stun01.sipphone.com. This service is used by the E7000 Web UI and should be enabled on the computer running the web UI.

qas.question: How can unprocessed versions of files from GitHub be accessed according to the context?

answers.text: Unprocessed versions of files stored in GitHub can be accessed through the URL: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/. This URL serves as a direct link to the raw content of files in GitHub repositories.

qas.question: What is the significance of the URL http://api.sound-machine.com in the E7000 system?

answers.text: The URL http://api.sound-machine.com is significant in the E7000 system as it is utilized for SoundMachine services, which may be integral for audio-related functionalities within the system. It is essential for ensuring proper interaction with the SoundMachine API.

qas.question: Which URL is necessary for E7000 Warranty Support?

answers.text: The URL necessary for E7000 Warranty Support is http://api.bogenedu.com/api/customers. This URL is specified as required in the provided context.

Table 1-2,  Network Application Services
Service
Description
Required

Apache
Used as the web server to drive the 
E7000 web interface.
Mandatory
E7000
DHCP
Supplies dynamic IP addresses to the 
E7000 system server and associated 
devices. (DHCP is the acronym for 
Dynamic Host Configuration 
Protocol.) It also supplies the Trivial 
File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server IP 
address or host name to devices on 
the network via option_66.
Optional
Network

Resolves host names to IP addresses. 
DNS is an acronym for Domain 
Name System, a hierarchical naming 
system for computers, servers, or 
other resources connected to either 
the Internet or to a private network.

ICE
STUN

Resolves IP addresses behind 
Network Address Translation (NAT)/
firewall.

- Traversal Using Relays around NAT

qas.question: What role does Apache play in the network application services?

answers.text: Apache serves as the web server that drives the E7000 web interface, making it a mandatory component for the system's operation. This ensures that users can access and interact with the web-based features of the E7000.

qas.question: Is DHCP mandatory or optional for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: DHCP is optional for the E7000 system server. It supplies dynamic IP addresses and TFTP server information, but it is not required for the operation of the E7000.

qas.question: What does DNS stand for and what is its function?

answers.text: DNS stands for Domain Name System. Its function is to resolve host names to IP addresses, allowing computers, servers, and other resources to be identified and accessed over the Internet or a private network.

qas.question: How do ICE, STUN, and TURN relate to Network Address Translation?

answers.text: ICE (Interactive Connectivity Establishment), STUN (Session Traversal Utilities for NAT), and TURN (Traversal Using Relays around NAT) are protocols used to facilitate communication between devices behind Network Address Translation (NAT) and firewalls. STUN allows devices to discover their public IP addresses and the type of NAT they are behind, while TURN provides a relay service to send and receive data when direct communication is not possible due to NAT restrictions. Together, they enable successful peer-to-peer connectivity in scenarios where NAT may otherwise hinder communication.

qas.question: What is the primary function of NTP in the network services?

answers.text: The primary function of NTP (Network Time Protocol) in the network services is to provide date and time synchronization for the E7000 system server and associated devices, such as IP phones and appliances. This ensures that all devices operate with a consistent and accurate time reference, which is essential for various time-sensitive operations and logging.

context:
5
SNMP
Provides the E7000 Linux server 
statistics via Simple Network 
Management Protocol (SNMP) v1 
through Port 161.
Optional
E7000
TFTP
TFTP is used by IP phone and E7000 
device provisioning. A TFTP server 
runs on the E7000 system server on 
port 69 (the standard TFTP port #).
Device provisioning files are stored 
on the E7000 system server in 
directory: /srv/tftp.
This is the only directory exposed by 
the TFTP server.
Mandatory
E7000
Table 1-2,  Network Application Services (Continued)
Service
Description
Required
Location

qas.question: What protocol does the E7000 Linux server use to provide statistics?

answers.text: The E7000 Linux server provides statistics via Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) version 1 through Port 161. This service is optional.

qas.question: Through which port does the E7000 server provide SNMP statistics?

answers.text: The E7000 server provides SNMP statistics through Port 161 using Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v1.

qas.question: What is the primary use of TFTP in relation to the E7000 device?

answers.text: The primary use of TFTP in relation to the E7000 device is for IP phone and E7000 device provisioning. It enables the transfer of configuration files stored in the /srv/tftp directory on the E7000 system server, which operates on the standard TFTP port 69.

qas.question: On which port does the TFTP server run on the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The TFTP server on the E7000 system server runs on port 69, which is the standard TFTP port. Device provisioning files are stored in the directory /srv/tftp on the E7000 server.

qas.question: Where are the device provisioning files stored on the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The device provisioning files are stored in the directory /srv/tftp on the E7000 system server. This directory is the only one exposed by the TFTP server, which operates on port 69.

qas.question: Is the TFTP directory the only one exposed by the TFTP server?

answers.text: Yes, the TFTP server on the E7000 system server exposes only the directory /srv/tftp for device provisioning files. No other directories are accessible through the TFTP server.

qas.question: Is the SNMP service optional or mandatory for the E7000?

answers.text: The SNMP service for the E7000 is optional, as indicated in the context provided. It operates via SNMP v1 through Port 161.

qas.question: Is the TFTP service optional or mandatory for the E7000?

answers.text: The TFTP service is mandatory for the E7000, as it is used for IP phone and device provisioning. The TFTP server operates on port 69, and the device provisioning files are stored in the directory /srv/tftp on the E7000 system server.

context:
2 System Controller 
Setup Assistant
7
System Controller Setup Assistant
After you have attached network cables to the System Controller, you 
can launch the Setup Assistant, a series of wizards that takes you step 
by step through the configuration of the most important Nyquist set-
tings, via a web browser. If you are using Port A to access the System 
Controller, type http://192.168.1.10/setup/welcome in the web 
browser. If you are using a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol 
(DHCP) address via Port B, type http://<ip-address)/setup/wel-
come where <ip-addresss> is replaced by the DHCP server provided 
Internet Protocol (IP) address.  
When you select the Continue button on the initial Welcome screen, 
the Network Wizard launches. The Network Wizard allows you to 
configure the IP address setting on Ethernet ports A and B.
The System Controller has two network ports. Port A is always used 
by the Nyquist server to communicate with Nyquist devices and can 
be used to communicate with Internet based services. You can use 
Port A or Port B to access the System Controller via the Web UI. Port 
Figure 2-1, Setup Assistant Welcome Screen

qas.question: [What is the purpose of the Setup Assistant for the System Controller?]

answers.text: The Setup Assistant for the System Controller guides users through the configuration of essential Nyquist settings via a web browser. It includes wizards for setting up network configurations for the controller's Ethernet ports, ensuring proper communication with Nyquist devices and internet services.

qas.question: [How do you access the Setup Assistant using Port A?]

answers.text: To access the Setup Assistant using Port A, type http://192.168.1.10/setup/welcome in your web browser. This URL allows you to connect to the System Controller's initial Welcome screen.

qas.question: [What IP address format is used when accessing the Setup Assistant with a DHCP address?]

answers.text: When accessing the Setup Assistant with a DHCP address, the IP address format is http://<ip-address>/setup/welcome, where <ip-address> represents the DHCP server-provided Internet Protocol (IP) address.

qas.question: [What happens when you select the Continue button on the Welcome screen?]

answers.text: When you select the Continue button on the Welcome screen, the Network Wizard launches, allowing you to configure the IP address settings for Ethernet ports A and B on the System Controller. Port A is used for communication with Nyquist devices and Internet-based services.

qas.question: [Which network port is always used by the Nyquist server for communication?]

answers.text: Port A is always used by the Nyquist server to communicate with Nyquist devices and can also be utilized for communication with Internet-based services.

qas.question: [Can both Port A and Port B be used to access the System Controller via the Web UI?]

answers.text: Yes, both Port A and Port B can be used to access the System Controller via the Web UI. Port A is primarily used for communication with Nyquist devices and internet services, while Port B can be utilized for access through a DHCP address.

qas.question: [What does the Network Wizard allow you to configure?]

answers.text: The Network Wizard allows you to configure the IP address settings on Ethernet ports A and B of the System Controller. It initiates after selecting the Continue button on the initial Welcome screen.

qas.question: [What type of cables need to be attached before launching the Setup Assistant?]

answers.text: Before launching the Setup Assistant, network cables need to be attached to the System Controller. These cables connect to the Ethernet ports A and B for communication with Nyquist devices or Internet-based services.

qas.question: [Is Port A used for communication with internet-based services?]

answers.text: Yes, Port A is used by the Nyquist server to communicate with Nyquist devices and can also be used to communicate with Internet-based services.

qas.question: [What settings does the Setup Assistant primarily focus on?]

answers.text: The Setup Assistant primarily focuses on configuring the most important Nyquist settings, specifically the IP address settings for the Ethernet ports A and B. It guides users through a series of wizards for this configuration via a web browser.

context:
8
B is an optional port that, when configured, is always used by the 
Nyquist server to communicate with Internet based services. 
When setting up the network ports, you must indicate if the IP 
address will be provided by a DHCP Server or if a static IP address will 
be used. If you are using a static IP address, you must provide the IP 
Address, Subnet Mask, and Gateway for the port or ports. Through 
the Network Wizard, you also indicate if Port B will be used and 
optionally provide the name of the Domain Name System (DNS), 
which is used to resolve host names to IP addresses.
After completing the information for the Network Wizard, select Save 
and Reset Network Interfaces. Resetting the Network Interfaces will 
take several minutes. A progress bar will appear on the screen.
After the Network Wizard completes, type the IP address of the 
server in the address bar. The next wizard that launches is the License 
Activation Key wizard. This wizard displays the configuration for Port 
A and (if used) Port B. 
Enter your License Activation Key and select Continue. 
The Product Activation screen that appears provides the following 
information about your Nyquist license:
• Version number
• Maximum concurrent call limit
• Maximum number of stations
• Maximum number of zones
• Maximum number of paging queues
• Whether Text-To-Speech or Maps features are enabed
• Expiration dates for software maintenance and for this software 
license
When product activation completes, a customer information form 
appears; fill in the form. After the form is completed, the Dialing 
Length Wizard appears. If you already know how to configure a 
Note: Verify the network setup is correct before continuing. If the 
displayed IP addresses are not correct, go back to the Network 
Wizard and make any required changes before proceeding with 
the License Activation Wizard.
Note: Do not close the browser or the License Activation Key page.

qas.question: What is the purpose of Port B in the Nyquist server setup?

answers.text: Port B in the Nyquist server setup is an optional port used for communication with Internet-based services. It requires configuration and can utilize either a DHCP server for IP address assignment or a static IP address setup.

qas.question: How do you indicate whether to use a DHCP server or a static IP address in the Network Wizard?

answers.text: In the Network Wizard, you indicate whether to use a DHCP server or a static IP address by selecting the appropriate option provided in the setup. If choosing a static IP address, you must then enter the IP Address, Subnet Mask, and Gateway for the port or ports.

qas.question: What information must be provided when using a static IP address?

answers.text: When using a static IP address, you must provide the IP Address, Subnet Mask, and Gateway for the port or ports. Additionally, you may also indicate the Domain Name System (DNS) for resolving host names to IP addresses.

qas.question: What happens after you complete the Network Wizard and select Save and Reset Network Interfaces?

answers.text: After completing the Network Wizard and selecting Save and Reset Network Interfaces, the system will take several minutes to reset the network interfaces, and a progress bar will appear on the screen. Once the process is complete, you can enter the server's IP address in the browser to launch the License Activation Key wizard.

qas.question: What does the License Activation Key wizard display after entering the server's IP address?

answers.text: After entering the server's IP address, the License Activation Key wizard displays the configuration for Port A and, if used, Port B. It also prompts the user to enter their License Activation Key and provides information about the Nyquist license, including version number, maximum concurrent call limit, and other relevant features and expiration dates.

qas.question: Which details about the Nyquist license are provided during the Product Activation screen?

answers.text: The Product Activation screen provides details about the Nyquist license, including the version number, maximum concurrent call limit, maximum number of stations, maximum number of zones, maximum number of paging queues, whether Text-To-Speech or Maps features are enabled, and expiration dates for software maintenance and the software license.

qas.question: What form must be filled out after product activation is completed?

answers.text: After product activation is completed, a customer information form must be filled out. Once this form is completed, the Dialing Length Wizard will appear.

qas.question: What appears after the customer information form in the setup process?

answers.text: After the customer information form is completed, the Dialing Length Wizard appears in the setup process.

qas.question: What should be verified before proceeding with the License Activation Wizard?

answers.text: Before proceeding with the License Activation Wizard, verify that the network setup is correct, including the displayed IP addresses. If any addresses are incorrect, return to the Network Wizard to make the necessary changes.

qas.question: What should not be closed during the License Activation process?

answers.text: The browser or the License Activation Key page should not be closed during the License Activation process. Closing it may disrupt the activation procedure.

context:
9
System Controller, you can select Expert Setup, which takes you to 
the Login page. The Dialing Length, Station, User, and Timezone 
Wizard views also have an Expert Setup button. The Expert Setup 
button marks all the set up database entries visited so you are not 
redirected back to any of the wizards.
When you login, you can view the product dashboard. You can then 
manually complete system configuration using the Admin Web UI 
(see the Nyquist E7000 System Administrator Manual).
Otherwise, you can continue using the setup wizards to do the fol-
lowing:
• Set the dialing length (number of digits) used by stations in your 
system.
• Create the Admin Web UI station.
• Update the password for the Admin user.
• Set the time zone to be used by your system.
• Specify the Network Time Server.
Once you complete all of the setup wizards, the logon screen 
appears.
Note: If you have not set a new password, you will need to enter 
the default username admin and the default password bogen to 
log into the system. Login credentials are case sensitive.
Note: When updating the password, ensure that you maintain a 
record of the new password in a secure place.

qas.question: What feature allows access to the Login page for advanced configuration?

answers.text: The Expert Setup feature allows access to the Login page for advanced configuration. It can be accessed from the System Controller and various setup wizard views, marking all visited setup database entries to prevent redirection to the wizards.

qas.question: What happens when you click the Expert Setup button in the wizards?

answers.text: Clicking the Expert Setup button in the wizards marks all the setup database entries visited, preventing you from being redirected back to any of the wizards. It takes you to the Login page, allowing manual configuration through the Admin Web UI.

qas.question: What is the default username and password for logging into the system?

answers.text: The default username for logging into the system is "admin" and the default password is "bogen." Please note that the login credentials are case sensitive.

qas.question: What can you manually configure after logging into the product dashboard?

answers.text: After logging into the product dashboard, you can manually complete system configuration using the Admin Web UI as detailed in the Nyquist E7000 System Administrator Manual. This includes configuring various system settings beyond the setup wizards.

qas.question: Which setup wizard allows you to specify the number of digits for station dialing?

answers.text: The setup wizard that allows you to specify the number of digits for station dialing is the Dialing Length Wizard. This wizard is part of the Expert Setup options available after logging in to the system.

qas.question: How can you update the password for the Admin user?

answers.text: To update the password for the Admin user, access the setup wizard from the product dashboard after logging in. Navigate to the relevant section where you can modify the password and ensure to record the new password in a secure place.

qas.question: What does the process of completing all setup wizards lead to?

answers.text: Completing all the setup wizards leads to the appearance of the logon screen. After this, you can log into the system using the appropriate credentials.

qas.question: Why is it important to keep a record of the new password securely?

answers.text: It is important to keep a record of the new password securely to prevent unauthorized access to the system and ensure that you can access the Admin Web UI when needed. Losing the password may result in being locked out of critical system configuration and management functions.

qas.question: What information is required to specify a time server during setup?

answers.text: To specify a Network Time Server during setup, you need to provide the server's address (such as an IP address or hostname). Ensure this information is correctly entered to maintain accurate system time.

qas.question: Are the login credentials for the system case sensitive?

answers.text: Yes, the login credentials for the system are case sensitive. If you have not set a new password, the default username is "admin" and the default password is "bogen".

context:
3 Best Practices
11
Best Practices
This section details recommendations and best practices to use when:
• Updating the Nyquist E7000 system server software to a new soft-
ware release
• Updating Nyquist appliance firmware (computer software stored 
on the appliance)
• Using System Backups
3.1
Updating Nyquist Software
New Nyquist server software may include patches to address known 
issues or new releases that provide additional features. The latest 
E7000 server software can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers 
website: 
http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/
Note: Before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances, you 
must ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest 
release. The latest firmware release can be obtained from the 
secured ES Dealers website: http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-
secure-dealer-resources/
Note: Before beginning the install process, make sure that your 
Nyquist system server can access the required URLs or web sites 
(see "Whitelisted Web Addresses” on page 2 from a Chrome 
browser.

qas.question: What is the purpose of updating the Nyquist E7000 system server software?

answers.text: The purpose of updating the Nyquist E7000 system server software is to implement patches that address known issues and to introduce new features. Ensuring that the software is up-to-date enhances system performance and reliability.

qas.question: Where can the latest Nyquist server software be accessed?

answers.text: The latest Nyquist server software can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers website at http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/. Ensure that your Nyquist system server is able to access this URL before proceeding with the installation.

qas.question: Why is it important to update the appliance firmware before using Nyquist appliances?

answers.text: Updating the appliance firmware before using Nyquist appliances is crucial because it ensures the system operates with the latest features, security patches, and fixes for known issues. Running outdated firmware may lead to compatibility problems and hinder performance.

qas.question: How can one obtain the latest firmware release for the Nyquist appliances?

answers.text: The latest firmware release for Nyquist appliances can be obtained from the secured ES Dealers website at http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/. It is essential to ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest release before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances.

qas.question: What should be verified regarding web access before starting the installation process?

answers.text: Before starting the installation process, verify that your Nyquist system server can access the required URLs or websites listed in the documentation. This should be done using a Chrome browser, as indicated in the "Whitelisted Web Addresses" section.

qas.question: What resource provides information on whitelisted web addresses for the Nyquist system?

answers.text: Information on whitelisted web addresses for the Nyquist system can be found on page 2 of the best practices document. Users should refer to this section prior to beginning the installation process to ensure the Nyquist system server can access the required URLs.

qas.question: What are the two types of updates mentioned for the Nyquist system?

answers.text: The two types of updates mentioned for the Nyquist system are server software updates and appliance firmware updates. Server software updates may include patches for known issues or new features, while firmware updates involve the computer software stored on the appliance itself.

qas.question: What website is designated for secured ES Dealers resources related to Nyquist?

answers.text: The designated website for secured ES Dealers resources related to Nyquist is http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/. This site provides access to the latest E7000 server software and firmware updates.

qas.question: What types of enhancements might new Nyquist server software include?

answers.text: New Nyquist server software may include patches to address known issues and additional features that enhance system functionality. These updates ensure improved performance, security, and overall user experience.

qas.question: Why is it necessary to address known issues through system software updates?

answers.text: It is necessary to address known issues through system software updates to ensure the optimal performance, stability, and security of the Nyquist E7000 system. Updates may include patches that mitigate vulnerabilities and resolve existing bugs, which can enhance the overall user experience and prevent potential system failures or breaches.

context:
12
When updating to a new Nyquist server software release, use the 
Admin Web UI to perform a system update unless directed by techni-
cal support. Performing a system update ensures that all configura-
tion data, call detail records, recordings, voice mail, and all upload 
announcements, alarms, tones, and songs are retained and are avail-
able after the system software update.
To perform a system update:
Step 1
From the navigation bar, select System Parameters.
Step 2
From the System Parameters page, select System 
Update, locate the System Update file, and then select 
Import.
Perform the server system update process before updating Nyquist 
appliance software.
3.1.1
Assigning Permissions for New Features
After a new software release is installed, permissions for features 
introduced by this new release must be set for the roles that will use 
these features. 
To assign permissions for these new features:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, select Roles.
Step 2
On the Roles page, select the Permissions icon next to 
the role that you want to edit permissions for.
Step 3
On the Edit Permissions page, make desired changes.
Step 4
Select Save.
For more information, refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Administra-
tor Manual.
Note: System backups created by older versions of the server soft-
ware are not compatible with the newer releases and should not be 
used to restore configuration data.

qas.question: What is the preferred method for performing a system update on the Nyquist server software?

answers.text: The preferred method for performing a system update on the Nyquist server software is to use the Admin Web UI. This ensures that all configuration data, call detail records, recordings, and other important elements are retained after the update, unless otherwise directed by technical support.

qas.question: What types of data are retained after performing a system update?

answers.text: After performing a system update, all configuration data, call detail records, recordings, voice mail, and uploaded announcements, alarms, tones, and songs are retained and available.

qas.question: What is the first step in performing a system update on the Nyquist server?

answers.text: The first step in performing a system update on the Nyquist server is to select "System Parameters" from the navigation bar. Then, on the System Parameters page, you select "System Update," locate the System Update file, and select "Import."

qas.question: What must be done after installing a new software release concerning permissions?

answers.text: After installing a new software release, permissions for features introduced in that release must be set for the relevant roles. This involves selecting the role to edit, adjusting the permissions on the Edit Permissions page, and then saving the changes.

qas.question: How do you access the permissions settings for a specific role?

answers.text: To access the permissions settings for a specific role, select "Roles" from the navigation bar, then click the Permissions icon next to the desired role on the Roles page. From there, you can make changes on the Edit Permissions page and save them.

qas.question: What is the consequence of using system backups from older versions of the server software with newer releases?

answers.text: Using system backups created by older versions of the server software with newer releases is not compatible and should not be used to restore configuration data. This could lead to data loss or corruption, as the newer software may not recognize or correctly handle the older backup format.

qas.question: Where can you find more information regarding Nyquist system administration?

answers.text: More information regarding Nyquist system administration can be found in the Nyquist E7000 System Administrator Manual. This manual provides detailed guidance on system updates, permissions, and other administrative tasks.

qas.question: Why is it important to perform the server system update process before updating Nyquist appliance software?

answers.text: It is important to perform the server system update process before updating Nyquist appliance software to ensure that all configuration data, call detail records, recordings, and other essential elements are retained and available after the update. Additionally, performing the server update first helps maintain compatibility with new software features and permissions.

context:
13
3.2
Updating Appliance Firmware
The firmware for all devices used with the E7000 system must be 
compatible with the software installed on the E7000 server, and all 
Nyquist appliances in a given installation should be configured to run 
the same version firmware.
Nyquist application firmware releases can be accessed from the 
secured ES Dealers website: 
http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/
Firmware can be updated for E7000 stations and Analog Station 
Bridge (ASB) devices through the Admin Web UI or through the 
appliance’s web UI. For information about the appliance’s web UI, 
refer to the device’s configuration manual.
Through the E7000 Admin Web UI, you can upload a firmware file to 
the E7000 system server, download firmware to a station or ASB, view 
a list of stations and ASBs that are linked to a firmware name, set 
default firmware for any stations and bridge devices to be added, and 
delete firmware entries. For information about using the Admin Web 
UI, refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Administrator Manual.
Note: Before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances, you 
must ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest 
release. The latest firmware release can be obtained from the 
secured ES Dealers website: http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-
secure-dealer-resources/

qas.question: What must the firmware for Nyquist appliances be compatible with?

answers.text: The firmware for Nyquist appliances must be compatible with the software installed on the E7000 server. Additionally, all Nyquist appliances in a given installation should run the same version of firmware.

qas.question: Where can Nyquist application firmware releases be accessed?

answers.text: Nyquist application firmware releases can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers website at http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/. It is essential that the firmware for all devices is compatible with the E7000 server software.

qas.question: How can firmware be updated for E7000 stations and ASB devices?

answers.text: Firmware for E7000 stations and Analog Station Bridge (ASB) devices can be updated through the Admin Web UI by uploading a firmware file to the E7000 system server and downloading it to the respective devices. Alternatively, updates can also be performed via the appliance’s web UI, as detailed in the device's configuration manual.

qas.question: What functionalities are available through the E7000 Admin Web UI for firmware management?

answers.text: The E7000 Admin Web UI allows users to upload firmware files, download firmware to stations or ASB devices, view linked firmware for stations and ASBs, set default firmware for new devices, and delete firmware entries. It is essential to ensure that appliance firmware is updated to the latest release before configuration or use.

qas.question: Why is it important to ensure that appliance firmware is updated before configuration or use?

answers.text: It is important to ensure that appliance firmware is updated before configuration or use to guarantee compatibility with the E7000 server software and to ensure all Nyquist appliances in an installation are running the same version. This helps prevent potential operational issues and ensures optimal performance of the system.

qas.question: What manual should be referred to for information about the Admin Web UI?

answers.text: For information about using the Admin Web UI, refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Administrator Manual. This manual will provide guidance on uploading firmware, managing firmware entries, and other related tasks.
